pageContext.claim: “How do you impeach a president who has won perhaps the greatest election of all time, done nothing wrong (no Collusion with Russia, it was the Dems that Colluded), had the most successful first two years of any president, and is the most popular Republican in party history 93%?”
pageContext.analysis: Trump won the Electoral College but lost the popular vote. The special counsel continues to investigate potential illegal coordination between Russia and Trump's campaign, and no conclusions have been announced. It's false to say Democrats colluded with Russia during the election. Trump lays claim to the most successful first two years of any president, but the whirlwind of accomplishments under presidents such as Franklin D. Roosevelt, Lyndon B. Johnson, Ronald Reagan and Barack Obama exceed Trump’s efforts. One right-leaning poll had Trump at 90 percent approval among Republicans, not 93. In any case, President George W. Bush had higher support among Republicans than 93 percent.
